mdcr:RatingsOrg.organizationID: Office of FIlm and Literature Classification
mdcr:RatingsOrg.md:DisplayName: Office of FIlm and Literature Classification

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Suitable for general audiences
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: Anyone can be shown or sold this.

mdcr:Explanation.div: G films should have very low levels of things like frightening scenes. However, not all G level films are intended for family audiences and it is always a good idea to look at reviews and plot information before taking children to any film

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Parental guidance recommended for younger viewers
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: Films and games with a PG label can be sold, hired, or shown to anyone.

mdcr:Explanation.div: The PG label means guidance from a parent or guardian is recommended for younger viewers. It is important to remember that PG films can be aimed at an adult audience and to be aware of the content of a film if you are taking children to it

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 13 years of age and over unless accompanied by parent/guardian
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: The RP label means that the film or DVD can only be watched by someone under the age on the label if they are with a parent or guardian (an adult over 18).

mdcr:Explanation.div: You will see these labels on films and DVDs. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they allow unaccompanied children to access these films.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 13 years of age and over
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: It is illegal to sell, hire, show or give a film or game with an age restricted label to anyone under the age specified.

mdcr:Explanation.div: If something has one of these labels it can only be supplied to people of and over the age shown on the label. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they supply an age-restricted item to someone who is not legally allowed to access it. You will see these labels on films, games, DVDs and a few music recordings, magazines and books.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 15 years of age and over
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: It is illegal to sell, hire, show or give a film or game with an age restricted label to anyone under the age specified.

mdcr:Explanation.div: If something has one of these labels it can only be supplied to people of and over the age shown on the label. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they supply an age-restricted item to someone who is not legally allowed to access it. You will see these labels on films, games, DVDs and a few music recordings, magazines and books.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Suitable for (but not restricted to) mature audiences 16 years and up
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: Films and games with an M label can be sold, hired, or shown to anyone.

mdcr:Explanation.div: Films with an M label are more suitable for mature audiences. When considering whether to let a child see an M-rated film, it?s a good idea to find out what the film is about ? and to always remember to check the descriptive note.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 16 years of age and over unless accomp[anied by Parent/Guardian
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: The RP label means that the film or DVD can only be watched by someone under the age on the label if they are with a parent or guardian (an adult over 18).

mdcr:Explanation.div: You will see these labels on films and DVDs. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they allow unaccompanied children to access these films.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 16 years of age and over
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: It is illegal to sell, hire, show or give a film or game with an age restricted label to anyone under the age specified.

mdcr:Explanation.div: If something has one of these labels it can only be supplied to people of and over the age shown on the label. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they supply an age-restricted item to someone who is not legally allowed to access it. You will see these labels on films, games, DVDs and a few music recordings, magazines and books.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to persons 18 years of age and over
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: It is illegal to sell, hire, show or give a film or game with an age restricted label to anyone under the age specified.

mdcr:Explanation.div: If something has one of these labels it can only be supplied to people of and over the age shown on the label. A parent, shop or cinema is breaking the law if they supply an age-restricted item to someone who is not legally allowed to access it. You will see these labels on films, games, DVDs and a few music recordings, magazines and books.

mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Label: Restricted to a particular class of persons, or for particular purposes, or both, specified by the Office of Film and Literature Classification
mdcr:Descriptor.mdcr:Definition: R means that there is a special restriction.

mdcr:Explanation.div: Refer to the words on the right of the label for the full conditions.
